articles.description: The penumbral part of the lunar eclipse, which is difficult to discern, will start at 9:20 pm on Monday night, while the partial phase will start at 10:52 pm.
articles.content:
A lunar eclipse will occur on the night of August 7 (Monday), continuing until early the next morning, and will be visible in India and all over Asia, Europe, and Africa.

articles.title: Donald Trump tells NASA to send Americans to the moon, prepare for Mars - Hindustan Times
articles.description: US President Donald Trump signed a new space policy directive, which calls on NASA to ramp up its efforts to send people to deep space.
articles.content:
US President Donald Trump directed NASA on Monday to send Americans to the moon for the first time since 1972, in order to prepare for future trips to Mars.

articles.title: Mars absorbed water on its surface like a sponge: study - Hindustan Times
articles.description: Although today’s Martian surface is barren, frozen and uninhabitable, a trail of evidence points to a once warmer, wetter planet, where water flowed freely.
articles.content:
The Martian surface may have reacted with and absorbed the water that once flowed on the red planet, making it uninhabitable, scientists suggest.

articles.title: Pink algae, spidery starfish: Robot gives rare glimpse under Antarctic sea ice - Hindustan Times
articles.description: While species like penguin, seals and whale often steal the show in the Antarctic, a robot has captured footage which reveals that underwater world beneath the ice capes is equally diverse and houses habitation full of myriad colours.
articles.content:
An underwater robot has captured a rare glimpse beneath the Antarctic sea ice, revealing a colourful world filled with coconut-shaped sponges, dandelion-like worms, pink algae and spidery starfish.

articles.description: The telescope, located 5,250 meters above sea level, will detect and gather precise data on primordial gravitational waves in the Northern Hemisphere.
